Welcome to the Responsive Web Design Seminar

CLASS OBJECTIVE

Students will learn how to create websites that are optimized for all possible viewing sizes, across multiple devices. Topics covered include: Mobile First vs Desktop Down strategies, becoming responsive, adjusting to a responsive workflow, working with fluid typography, flexible grids, adaptive images, and media queries.

At the conclusion of this course, the student should be able to:

  • Be familiar with the ever-changing landscape of devices accessing the web, and the strategies to deliver quality user experiences to each of them.
  • Utilize CSS3 media queries to deliver targeted CSS rules to different devices.
  • Style type using relative units for a flexible typography system.
  • Convert pixel-based layouts to a flexible grid using percentages.
  • Understand the challenges and solutions available for adaptive images.
